summary: David S. Morales was a CIA officer with 25 years of service, including assignments in Europe, Latin America, and East Asia. His official personnel file contains biographic information, employment history, and performance evaluations within the CIA. He received foreign awards and decorations, and his retention of these awards was reviewed and approved. He also had an official cover established within the US Army Staff Group under the MAZE unit, starting in July 1971. The documents highlight his long career in the CIA and his involvement in various operations and assignments.
significance: The provided documents do not explicitly mention David S. Morales's role or significance in the JFK assassination context. They primarily focus on his CIA career, awards, and official cover. Further documents would be needed to establish any connection to the JFK assassination.
